fusilli.trainïƒ

Contains the train_and_test function: trains and tests a model and, if k_fold trained, a fold.

store_trained_model(trained_model, trained_models_dict)[source]ïƒ

Stores the trained model to a dictionary. If model type is already in dictionary (e.g. if itâ€™s a kfold model), append the model to the list of models.

Parameters:

  • trained_model (pytorch lightning model) â€“ Trained model.

  • trained_models_dict (dict) â€“ Dictionary of trained models.

Returns:

trained_models_dict â€“ Dictionary of trained models.

Return type:

dict

train_and_save_models(data_module, params, fusion_model, extra_log_string_dict=None, layer_mods=None, max_epochs=1000, enable_checkpointing=True, show_loss_plot=False)[source]ïƒ

Trains/tests the model and saves the trained model to a dictionary for further analysis. If the training type is kfold, it will train and test the model for each fold and store the trained models in a list under the model type key.

Parameters:

  • data_module (pytorch lightning data module) â€“ Data module.

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • fusion_model (class) â€“ Fusion model class.

  • extra_log_string_dict (dict) â€“ Dictionary of extra log strings. Extra string to add to the run name during logging. e.g. if youâ€™re running the same model with different hyperparameters, you can add the hyperparameters. Input format {â€œnameâ€: â€œvalueâ€}. In the run name, the extra string will be added as â€œname_valueâ€. And a tag will be added as â€œname_valueâ€.

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications. Used to modify the architecture of the model. Input format {â€œmodelâ€: {â€œlayer_groupâ€: â€œmodificationâ€}, â€¦}. e.g. {â€œTabularCrossmodalAttentionâ€: {â€œmod1_layersâ€: new mod 1 layers nn.ModuleDict}} Default None.

  • max_epochs (int) â€“ Maximum number of epochs. Default 1000.

  • enable_checkpointing (bool) â€“ Whether to enable checkpointing. Default True.

  • show_loss_plot (bool) â€“ Whether to show the loss plot. Default False.

Returns:

trained_models_dict â€“ Dictionary of trained model (key is model name, value is either single trained model for train/test training or a list of trained models for k-fold training).

Return type:

dict

train_and_test(data_module, params, k, fusion_model, extra_log_string_dict=None, layer_mods=None, max_epochs=1000, enable_checkpointing=True, show_loss_plot=False)[source]ïƒ

Trains and tests a model and, if k_fold trained, a fold.

Parameters:

  • data_module (pytorch lightning data module) â€“ Data module. Contains the train and val dataloaders.

  • params (dict) â€“ Dictionary of parameters.

  • k (int) â€“ Fold number.

  • fusion_model (class) â€“ Fusion model class.

  • extra_log_string_dict (dict) â€“

    Dictionary of extra log strings. Extra string to add to the run name during logging.

    e.g. if youâ€™re running the same model with different hyperparameters, you can add the hyperparameters. Input format {â€œnameâ€: â€œvalueâ€}. In the run name, the extra string will be added as â€œname_valueâ€. And a tag will be added as â€œname_valueâ€.

  • layer_mods (dict) â€“ Dictionary of layer modifications. Used to modify the architecture of the model. Input format {â€œmodelâ€: {â€œlayer_groupâ€: â€œmodificationâ€}, â€¦}. e.g. {â€œTabularCrossmodalAttentionâ€: {â€œmod1_layersâ€: new mod 1 layers nn.ModuleDict}} Default None.

  • max_epochs (int) â€“ Maximum number of epochs. Default 1000.

  • enable_checkpointing (bool) â€“ Whether to enable checkpointing. Default True.

  • show_loss_plot (bool) â€“ Whether to show the loss plot. Default False. If True, the loss plot will be shown after training with plt.show() If False, the loss plot will be saved to the log directory.

Returns:

  • model (pytorch lightning model) â€“ Trained model.

  • trainer (pytorch lightning trainer) â€“ Trained trainer.

  • metric_1 (float) â€“ Metric 1 (depends on metric_name_list and params[â€œpred_typeâ€]).

  • metric_2 (float) â€“ Metric 2 (depends on metric_name_list and params[â€œpred_typeâ€]).

  • val_reals (list) â€“ List of validation real values.

  • val_preds (list) â€“ List of validation predicted values.
